io.launchowl.viewvalidationlibrary

Class Criteria<T extends android.view.View>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.launchowl.viewvalidationlibrary.Criteria<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of View being evaluated

    public class Criteria<T extends android.view.View>
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains a collection of Criteria.Condition objects.

    A Criteria is intended to be associated with a single View. One or more Criteria.Condition or Criteria.AsyncCondition objects can be added to the Criteria instance.

    All conditions can be evaluated by calling the evaluate(EvalCompleteListener) method. The method will deliver a single result (Validator.ValidationResult) to the supplied Criteria.EvalCompleteListener.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  Criteria.AsyncCondition<T extends android.view.View>
      An asynchronous condition is a single test that performs an asynchronous operation and then returns a true or false value to the supplied Criteria.AsyncConditionCompletionListener.
      static class  Criteria.AsyncConditionCompletionListener
      This class is responsible for notifying the Criteria object that an Criteria.AsyncCondition has completed its evaluation.
      static interface  Criteria.Condition<T>
      A condition is a single test that will return true or false.
      static interface  Criteria.EvalCompleteListener
      This interface is supplied to the evaluate(EvalCompleteListener) method and receives the final validation result after all conditions in a criteria object have been individually tested.

        public Criteria<T> test(Criteria.Condition<T> condition)
        Adds a Criteria.Condition to be tested.

        For example, the asynchronous operation could evaluate whether a username contains valid characters.
